section.p: Inspire all students to achieve their greatest potential

blockquote.p: All Indian Prairie School District 204 schools will remain closed through the end of the school year per Governor Pritzker's Executive Order. District 204 schools have implemented e‑learning to provide a continuity of instruction for students.
Meals are being provided through the end of the year for all students. Curbside grab and go breakfast and lunch can be ordered at no cost here.

ul.li: April 6: Remote Learning Planning Day for Teachers, No Student Participation
April 10: No School for Staff or Students per Previous School Calendar
April 15: Remote Learning Planning Day for Teachers, No Student Participation
April 29: Remote Learning Planning Day for Teachers, No Student Participation

span.p: Public health officials have stressed that social distancing is the most proactive approach to this health crisis. The Illinois Association of School Administrators has provided a graphic to explain social distance.

We understand you may have concerns about how the virus may impact your family. Agencies continue to focus on prevention and stress the best way to prevent infection is to avoid exposure to the virus.
In addition to social distancing, the Illinois Department of Public Health recommends the following:

ul.li: Wash your hands often with soap and water for at least 20 seconds. If soap and water are not available, use an alcohol-based hand sanitizer with at least 60% alcohol.
Avoid touching your eyes, nose, and mouth with unwashed hands.
Avoid close contact with people who are sick and contact your healthcare provider for a plan of care.
Stay home when you are sick.
Cover your cough or sneeze with a tissue, then throw the tissue in the trash.
Clean and disinfect frequently touched objects and surfaces.

span.p: If you have questions about COVID-19, call the Illinois Coronavirus Disease (COVID-19) Hotline at 1-800-889-3931, or send an email to DPH.SICK@ILLINOIS.GOV anytime, 24 hours a day, seven days a week.

li.a: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention
CDC: What You Need to Know About COVID-19
How to Talk with Children About COVID-19
State of IL Coronavirus (COVID-19) Response Site

span.p: District 204’s psychologists and social workers have provided the following information for parents who are looking for family mental health resources during the COVID-19 crisis:

li.a: 5 Ways to Help Teens Manage Anxiety
Care for Caregivers: Tips for Families and Educators
How to Help Your Children Stay Calm
